meanings.definition: The last part of something, especially a piece of meat.
meanings.sent1: After dinner, only the izzards of the roast chicken were left.
meanings.sent2: She only ate a few izzards of the pizza, saving the rest for later.
meanings.sent3: The cat happily devoured the izzards of tuna left in the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The chef carefully trimmed the izzards of fat from the steak before grilling.
meanings.sent5: The izzards of bacon sizzled in the pan, filling the kitchen with a delicious aroma.

meanings.definition: A small amount or portion of something.
meanings.sent1: He only had izzards of time to finish his homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: She added just a few izzards of sugar to her tea.
meanings.sent3: The child eagerly collected izzards of shells on the beach.
meanings.sent4: The artist used izzards of paint to create a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The hiker carried izzards of water in a small bottle during the trek.
